title: Agriculture orientation index for government expenditures
subtitle:
Agriculture Orientation Index (AOI) is defined as the agriculture share of government expenditures, divided by the agriculture share of GDP. An AOI >1 means the agriculture section receives a higher share of government spending relative to its value-added contribution. An AOI <1 reflects a lower orientation to agriculture, while an AOI equal to 1
reflects neutrality in a governmentâ€™s orientation to the agriculture sector.
sourceDesc: UN and Food Agriculture Organization FAO)
